materials.raw_text: Co: 160 g, Fe: 20 g, Nd: 20 g, P: 120 g, Tm: 40 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Buy from a metal supplier; Fe: Available at hardware stores or metallurgical suppliers; Nd: Purchase from rare earth suppliers; P: Chemical supply stores; Tm: Obtain from specialized rare earth vendors.
steps: Co: Buy from a metal supplier; Fe: Available at hardware stores or metallurgical suppliers; Nd: Purchase from rare earth suppliers; P: Chemical supply stores; Tm: Obtain from specialized rare earth vendors.

1. Measure each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Co, Fe, Nd, P, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the powder to a mixing bowl and ensure thorough blending.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Co, Fe, Nd, P, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the powder to a mixing bowl and ensure thorough blending.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the mixed powder into a crucible made of a suitable material (e.g., alumina) that can withstand high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace for sintering.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the mixed powder into a crucible made of a suitable material (e.g., alumina) that can withstand high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace for sintering.

steps: 1. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 4-6 hours to ensure that the material does not crack or deform.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 4-6 hours to ensure that the material does not crack or deform.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealing coat to protect the surface from oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealing coat to protect the surface from oxidation.
